author: mxs_
content:
Hello, not sure if this is the right place, regarding efforts to increase scalability and the security<>decentralization<>scalability trilemma, are there places / works / designs towards reducing the number of attestations?

i.e: something among the lines of defining a scaling factor N, have (active_validators_count/N) validators to attest during an epoch, have rewards & penalties be multiplied by N (which would move the cursor a bit away from security towards scalability). ~set of participating active validators could be a % N based on their index the active set to avoid introducing new structures. Just interested in reading material in that direction or similar to understand the trade-offs.

author: potuz
content: There is an effort to increase the maximum effective balance, which in theory, if many pools/validators opt-in, should reduce the number of attestations.
